summary: This bill, the Stop Shackling and Detaining Pregnant Women Act, aims to safeguard the humane treatment of pregnant and postpartum women in detention. It mandates pregnancy testing, establishes a presumption of release for pregnant individuals (with limited exceptions), prohibits the use of restraints except in extraordinary circumstances, and ensures access to comprehensive healthcare services, including reproductive healthcare. The bill also requires training for Department of Homeland Security employees, record-keeping of restraint use, and reports to Congress on detention practices.
